parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate. It focuses on a local Christmas event organized by Mihai Polițeanu, who is a mayor, but the post is not related to his electoral campaign.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience in Ploiești, Romania, aiming to reach children aged 6-14 and their parents. This is a public announcement, not a private communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to announce a local Christmas event and the selection process for children to participate. There is no mention of voting, elections, or support for any political candidate. The event is community-focused and unrelated to the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post could be considered a form of public announcement, it does not fall under journalistic standards. It's a promotional post for a community event.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express personal opinions; it's a factual announcement of a public event.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3958530141049803</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a local Christmas event organized by Mihai Polițeanu, the mayor of Ploiești.  While Polițeanu is a public figure and the post is paid advertising, the content itself is entirely focused on a community event unrelated to the parliamentary elections.  There is no mention of any political party, candidate, or call to action related to voting. The post meets the criteria of a community announcement and does not constitute electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
